meanings.definition: To provide with fresh air or expose to the circulation of air.
meanings.sent1: The room was ventilated by opening the windows.
meanings.sent2: It is important to ventilate the attic to prevent mold.
meanings.sent3: The balloon was ventilated with helium for the party.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were ventilated during the meeting, sparking a lively discussion.
meanings.sent5: The forest was ventilated with the cool breeze, refreshing all who walked through.

meanings.definition: To expose to the action of the air; to air.
meanings.sent1: The clothes were ventilated outside to dry in the sun.
meanings.sent2: After painting, the room needed to be ventilated to remove the fumes.
meanings.sent3: The cake was ventilated with the sweet smell of vanilla.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were ventilated through his expressive artwork.
meanings.sent5: The old book was ventilated with the musty scent of history.

meanings.definition: To expose to the free circulation of air.
meanings.sent1: The warehouse was ventilated to keep the air fresh for the workers.
meanings.sent2: The basement needed to be ventilated to reduce the dampness.
meanings.sent3: The garden was ventilated with the scent of blooming flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was ventilated with new ideas after the inspiring lecture.
meanings.sent5: The stadium was ventilated with cheers and excitement during the game.
